storyInfo: Beeswax sets off on an unfamiliar journey in order to bring an Infected's belongings back to her homeland.

attributes.content: A Certain Rhodes Island Branch Office, Sargon

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: Yep... My brushes, essential oils, and sandpaper strips. All packed away.

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: Huh? What are you doing in my bag, little bug? Are you coming with me? You can't. Off you go.
Okay! Finished packing.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Wait, no. I need to say goodbye to Mr. Kadeem before I leave.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: That son of a bitch just up and left! Even leaving the stuff behind right next to the door! What the hell's with that?!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: S-Sorry, Mr. Kadeem. I shouldn't have tossed that bug out the door!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Ankhesena? No, don't get me wrong, I'm not talking about you!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: If it's not about me... did something happen?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Eh, it was before you got here. Last month, we had a temporary operator die of his disease. So I packed up his things to ship them back to his family.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: But the moment the local Messenger heard the package belonged to an Infected, he straight up refused to deliver it for me, saying it's bad luck. And that's after I got it all cleaned up so there's no risk of infection.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: B-But you do so many things for the people here. You give out medicine, you treat patients, and even teach them how to prevent getting infected...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Well, all that's... insignificant compared to the trauma and fear they have of Oripathy.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: *sigh*... I could deliver all this myself if it weren't for this leg. Maybe later.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Alright, forget about it. I see you've finished packing. Are you leaving today?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Yep, I got a message from Rhodes Island two days ago. My sister isn't there, and doesn't want me to go look for her.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: It doesn't say why, but I'm sure she has her reasons, and I respect her decision.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: You look real disappointed, though.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I-It's okay. I have my own trials to complete. I can't always be following in my sister's footsteps.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I'm glad you see it that way. That's a great first step. So do you have any plans or goals for the rest of your trip?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Hm... I haven't thought about where to go. But it's okay. I can think about it on the road.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hahaha. Come on, let me take your luggage and see you off. I've been real lucky to have you here to help out. Things would've been so much harder with just myself and my bad leg.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: No, no, I enjoyed helping. I'm the one who should be thankful for you taking such good care of me! Speaking of which...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Eh, don't. No need for all that here.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Mr. Kadeem!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: If this is everything he left behind, I can help you bring them to his family.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Sargon's deserts may be vast and endless, but our tribe has lived in the desert for a long time. We learn how to tread the sands from a very young age.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: And this won't get in the way of your trials?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: It won't. Giving others a helping hand is a part of them, too. A really important part!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: If that were coming from anyone else, I would've scoffed.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: But well... You found your way here from a tribe deep in the desert, all by yourself. I have no reason to refuse.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: So? So?!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: So... I'll let you handle his stuff. Be sure it gets back to his hometown.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: After all, that's the only wish he left us with.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Yeah... got it.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Based on Mr. Kadeem's description, looks like my destination is a pretty isolated tribe... Not sure exactly where it is.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hm... He did tell me I'd find it if I just follow all the signs after leaving the village.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Really though? I'm not so sure about this... The sign points west to a saxaul forest, and it points east to the red sands there.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Claps hands together) The golden sands, where the setting sun returns. Wheresoever the followers of the gods walk, they will never walk their journey alone.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: O Faceless God, grant me your blessings so that I may successfully cross this desert, allowing a soul that has drifted in the lands for years to return to his homeland.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Time to go.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: A breeze blows by. The sign lets out an unbearable creak and softly spins in the wind.
The sun... The sun has risen again. Have a walked a whole day already? I see nothing but saxauls here. How come I haven't made it to the red sands yet?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Where's the next sign Mr. Kadeem said I'd see? Didn't he say I'd find it after just half a day?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I'm so tired... I can't walk anymore. Let me find some shade to sit down in and get some rest.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: There's no exact location, and the route's already off. How am I supposed to find his hometown?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I wish my sister were here... She'd pet my head and tell me everything's okay.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Lowers head to look at her own hands.)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hm... I can do this too.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Pats her own head)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: It's okay, Ankhesena. Cheer up.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Stay calm. It'll work out somehow. Stand up and take a look at your surroundings. See what clues you can find.
attributes.name: Ankhesena
Ankhesena
attributes.content: Okay, standing up—

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: Waagh!
O-Ow... I stepped on my clothes.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Oh no, his stuff all spilled out. I gotta pick it back up.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Wah! Don't! Why does the wind have to blow now of all times?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Is this... a diary? I'm sorry, Mister. I didn't mean to look. The wind blew the pages open.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Closes the notebook)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: That short passage just now... Was that a description of his hometown? Maybe... I can find some clues in there.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: O God, please forgive this intrusion against the dead.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Opens the notebook)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'Time and again in my dreams, I make my way home, and my mother stands waiting for me under the date palms. Just like the day she watched me leave my home behind.'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'As my body worsens by the day, I reminisce about that oasis more and more fondly. I left her to chase my dreams, yet I've dreamt of her every night since my departure.'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'The rainy season and the drought season alternate with one another. A small pool of water forms a lake, only for it to dry into a salt marsh just as quickly...'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: He really missed that place. Almost the entire diary is about things that happened in his hometown.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Date palms, an oasis, and a seasonal lake...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: There are little bugs crawling all around here...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Picks one up to closely examine)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I shouldn't be too far from a water source. If luck's on my side, I might even find a settlement there.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Just gotta climb a few sand dunes. Good thing I brought a wooden board to sand ski with.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: *Knock*... Yep... Gotta tie it a bit tighter.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: It might get bumpy. I should roll my clothes up. It wouldn't be good if I tripped again.
attributes.name: Ankhesena
Ankhesena
attributes.content: Okay...

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: Three, two, one...

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: Whoaaaa—!
The town mentioned here? Let me think... I've been there, but it's been so many years. I can't say for sure if it's still there.
attributes.name: Knowledgeable Old Man

attributes.content: Do you know how to get there, Mister?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Ride a burdenbeast and keep heading northwest. Once you reach a rock formation that looks like a mushroom, head southwest a few more kilometers, and you should be there.
attributes.name: Knowledgeable Old Man

attributes.content: Do you remember anything about the environment around the town? Are there lots of date palms? Does a lake form when it rains?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Sorry, that doesn't ring a bell.
attributes.name: Knowledgeable Old Man

attributes.content: 'As I almost succumbed to despair, Mr. Kadeem saved me.'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'After a while at the office, my condition started to stabilize, and my mental state has also started to calm...'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Looks like he lived in that office until he died.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Pffft—
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Huh? Are you hungry? I have some hay here.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Munches)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Look at you eat. Your saliva's getting everywhere.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: The place you're looking for is hard to find, Miss. There are a number of oases both big and small to the north of our town, and nearly every one of them has a large field of date palms.
attributes.name: Erudite Woman

attributes.content: Then... Does the seasonal lake narrow it down?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Not much. Seasonal lakes don't always form in the same place. You can't count on finding anywhere with just that.
attributes.name: Erudite Woman

attributes.content: If you don't mind, could you circle where the oases are on this map?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Are you going to check one by one?
attributes.name: Erudite Woman

attributes.content: Yep, I made a promise, so I'll do it.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'Finally, I made enough money to leave. I don't know what lies beyond this desert, but everything there is new to me. Just that very thought fills me with excitement.'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: 'I only hope my enthusiasm will bear fruit. Farewell, my homeland.'
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hm, what are you reading, little girl?
attributes.name: Desert Merchant

attributes.content: It's... someone's past.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Desert Merchant

attributes.content: It's a diary.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Whatever the case, this is your stop. The place you're headed isn't too far from here. We need to be on our way, so this is as far as we can take you.
attributes.name: Desert Merchant

attributes.content: Thanks for the ride, Mister.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hahaha, not at all. If you weren't there to save my caravan from the quicksand, I would literally be six feet under right now.
attributes.name: Desert Merchant

attributes.content: May the sands bless the rest of your journey!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Haha... thanks!
attributes.name: Desert Merchant

attributes.content: This is the last oasis. O Faceless God, please grant me a miracle.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hello, is anybody home?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Anyone?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: This place looks pretty rundown. Doesn't look like anybody lives here.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Agh!
You entered my tribe's territory without our permission, outblood!
I-I didn't see anyone on my way here. I thought this oasis didn't belong to anybody.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Of course you didn't.
But why?!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Put down that spear before you ask any questions.
*Whimpers*... Okay.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Why is she acting like I wronged her when she was just doing me dirty?)
What are you doing here, outblood?
I was asked to deliver someone's belongings to his homeland.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I have all his things in this bag. Why don't you take a look? If he's not from here, I'll leave immediately.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Bring it over. Let me see.
He's never been back all these years... So he's passed away.
You knew him?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Right, going by seniority, he was my younger cousin. I took care of his mother before she passed away.
Does he have any other family besides you?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
Outblood, there aren't a whole lot more people in this tribe. The young ones have all left to make a living. The only ones left are the older folks, and there's less and less of them by the year.
What will happen to the tribe once everyone's gone?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Do you still not understand, prick? Our tribe will disappear soon. From the oasis, and from Sargon.
Then... What do we do with his things?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I'll bury them next to his mother.
(Grips onto her spear uneasily) Now that I delivered these, I... I'll leave now. I won't bother you anymore.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Prick, you're already here. Stay and help me. We only have his things, not his body, but his spirit has returned, and he needs a proper funeral.
Okay, no problem. I-I can help.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Then come with me. We need to get started.
Mister? M-May I ask you a question?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Go ahead.
If everyone's gone, why do you insist on staying?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Because I'm the tribe's priest. Until the tribe is gone for good, someone has to be here to guard it.
Besides, what if someone wants to come back? Like he did...
You want to throw the first dirt, kid?
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: M-May I?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: You're the one who brought him back. You have more than enough right to.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Um, Mr. Kadeem asked me to bring your belongings back to your home, and I made it. Please forgive me for all the accidents that occurred on the road.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: All fruits born on the lands eventually make their way back to the soil, buried and awaiting to sprout anew.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: My dear brother, may you return to your loving mother's embrace. May you find peace under the golden sands. May there never be tears wheresoever you go.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: (May he be blessed by the golden sands.)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Thanks for helping me. Do you want something to eat? It must have been a tough journey.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: No, no, this kind of journey is nothing out of the ordinary for my tribe.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I've never left this oasis. I can't imagine how your desert tribe lives. Just looking at the tumbling sands makes me afraid.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: There's nothing to be afraid of. A god lives in the desert, and He protects us.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: We used to believe the forest had a god too, and it was thanks to Him that our tribe managed to survive and prosper, but it looks like we've been abandoned.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Of course not. Gods don't abandon their children.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: But what if His children abandoned their faith in Him?
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: You mean those who left...?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Did he live a good life outside?
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Not really. He got infected with an incurable disease. Rocks grew on his body. It hurt, and could spread to other people. He would've been ostracized in lots of places.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Did it hurt when he died?
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: I don't know. He had already passed away by the time I got there... But Mr. Kadeem was there to take care of him, so he probably died peacefully. At the very least, he wasn't alone.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: And who's Mr. Kadeem?
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Mr. Kadeem's in charge of the place where he worked. He's very experienced when it comes to treating Oripathy.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I used to complain that he never came back to see his own mother one last time. He mentioned in his letter that it'd only take a day of travel on foot to get back here from where he settled down.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Was it... that close? *Whimper*... To tell the truth, I got lost on my way here. It took me half a month to find this place.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Perhaps he traveled somewhere else after he sent that letter.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: But now that I've heard what happened, I can understand why he wasn't willing to come back.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: Nobody here's ever come down with a disease like that. I wouldn't be able to do anything for his pain here, and if he spread it to others, I'd have no way to deal with that.
attributes.name: Tribe Priest

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Ankhesena opens her mouth only to find herself unable to say what she was going to say.
Once someone has set their mind on crossing a desert, they can no longer turn back. Because the sands that blow with the wind will undoubtedly swallow the path they'd taken.
And the courage they took so long to gather is never enough for them to look back at their unrecognizable past.
*Sigh*—
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: Old fool, stop sighing in front of the kids. You'll bring them bad luck.
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: You dare call me old with that white beard of yours? Take a look yourself. The ones who came back from their journeys this year are just half that of last year. What should we do if this keeps happening?
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: Who am I to influence how they think? Once they've experienced all the amazing things outside, who would come back here to live a life of nothing?
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: And how can you be so unbothered by that? The tribe will collapse one day if this keeps up.
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: I'm at my wits' end too, but we can't just keep the children here and not let them leave.
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: (Shakes head helplessly)
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: Right, I have something I need to discuss with you. I got a letter a few days ago, and I'm worried about what it says.
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: A child caught that disease and wants to come back...
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: That's a good thing. They should.
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: He said he's infected with an incurable disease, and he's worried about spreading it to others in the tribe... But I can't bear seeing one of our children stranded out there.
attributes.name: Tribe Elder

attributes.content: What should we do?
attributes.name: Worried Elder

attributes.content: (Tugs Carnelian's sleeve)
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Sis...
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: What's wrong, Ankhesena?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You'll go on your journey in a year. Will you come back after you leave?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Of course I will, it's just...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Sis?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: I don't know what He has in mind for me. What if He doesn't want me to stay here?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No... Once you leave, I'll keep praying to Him. Wherever His children walk, they are bound to be far from evil.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: That's not evil, Ankhesena. It's not...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: It's me, Mr. Kadeem. Ankhesena. Could you open the door, please?
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Coming, coming.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I thought you were on your journey? Did you manage to deliver his things?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: *pant*—*pant*—
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Maybe you should come in and catch your breath first. Here, have some water.
attributes.name: Office Operator
Ankhesena
attributes.content: I did...

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: (Glug-glug)

attributes.name: Ankhesena
attributes.content: And I gave him a proper burial with the priest there.
That's great, but you didn't come all the way back here to tell me that, did you?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Look at you. You're covered in sweat. Didn't I say you didn't have to come back?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: That's not why. I found it. I found what it is that I want to do.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: Hahaha, so you found a goal for your journey? Go on then, don't keep me in suspense.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I want to go to Rhodes Island. I want to go to the landship!
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: There are things there that I want to bring back to my tribe.
attributes.name: Ankhesena

attributes.content: She said those words in a sonorous, powerful way, completely unlike the soft voice she usually speaks in. Like the heavy, blazing sunset crushing the yellow desert outside the window.
And under the sunset's glow, the mark on her forehead glows ever radiant.
